title: Hampshire choir wins international competition
text:
0 comments 
A HAMPSHIRE based choir has won a prestigious music competition in London. 
Sansara Choir, comprising former boy and girl choristers from Winchester Cathedral and College, won the 2015 London International A Cappella Choir Competition hosted by Peter Philips and the Tallis Scholars at St John’s Smith Square. 
Beating fifteen other choirs from around the world they not only impressed the international jury but also gained the audience prize in recognition of their imaginative programming. 
Money from these awards will go some way towards Sansara’s ambition to produce a professional recording of their chosen repertoire, including music by Winchester-based composers. 
The win has delighted Tim Lowden , of Stockbridge Music (SM), who attended the first concert the choir performed at Northington Church near Alresford . 
Mr Lowden, of Stockbridge Music (SM), was so impressed by their sound and standard of performance that he booked them to perform in Stockbridge in April 2014. 
He had never before heard a choir made up of young choral scholars (all under 22 years old) producing such a fresh sound expertly controlled and moulded into an ensemble of real quality. Share article 
SM agreed to make a small donation towards the costs of this choirs first recording to enable them to promote themselves at the highest level.
